info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 01 at 6:56PM CDT until May 01 at 7:30PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM CDT FOR WESTERN RANDALL AND EASTERN DEAF SMITH COUNTIES... At 653 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 4 miles northwest of Dawn, or 11 miles northeast of Hereford, moving northeast at 40 mph. THIS IS A DESTRUCTIVE STORM FOR AREAS NEAR DAWN, JUST NORTH OF HEREFORD AND NEAR UMBARGER. HAZARD...Baseball size hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Storm chasers reported blown out windows due to baseball size hail. Widespread damage reported in Herford with blown out windows. A 67 mph wind gust was reported at the Hereford mesonet station. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be severely injured. Expect shattered windows, extensive damage to roofs, siding, and vehicles. Locations impacted include... Hereford, Canyon, Umbarger, Buffalo Lake, Dawn and Mescalero Park. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This is a dangerous storm. Prepare immediately for large destructive hail and strong winds capable of producing significant damage. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows.
